title: Strengthening and Unleashing America's Law Enforcement To Pursue Criminals and Protect Innocent Citizens

enrichment.summary: This Executive Order directs the federal government to support state and local law enforcement by providing resources, legal protections, training, and military assets to fight crime more effectively. It also aims to hold local officials accountable if they unlawfully obstruct law enforcement or impose harmful diversity-equity-inclusion policies that restrict policing.
potential_concerns: The orderâ€™s emphasis on aggressive policing and reduced oversight may lead to disproportionate targeting and civil rights infringements on African Americans and Hispanic/Latino Americans, raising concerns under the theme of civil-rights-enforcement.

Providing indemnification and legal defense for law enforcement officers may reduce accountability for misconduct, potentially harming communities, especially urban communities and individuals with mental health conditions who often interact with police.

Expanding the use of military and national security assets in local policing could militarize police forces, increasing the risk of excessive use of force in urban communities and further alienating minority populations.

Holding local officials legally accountable for implementing diversity, equity, and inclusion policies may limit efforts to address systemic biases in policing, negatively impacting minority communities and undermining civil-rights enforcement.
